content: I am a student of M.S. Computer Science in the School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at National University of Sciences & Technology, Islamabad. My research is focused on the applications of deep learning in computer vision and natural language processing, particularly using unsupervised and transfer learning techniques.
summary: I am a student of M.S. Computer Science in the School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at National University of Sciences & Technology, Islamabad. My research is focused on the applications of deep learning in computer vision and natural language processing, particularly using unsupervised and transfer learning techniques.
title: Atif Khurshid

summary: An investigation of the possibility of cross-lingual transfer learning of grammatical features in a multilingual text-to-text transformer.
title: Transfer learning grammar for multilingual surface realisation

summary: Implemented a transformer model to study the extent of cross-lingual transfer learning of grammatical features in multilingual surface realisation.
title: Transfer learning grammar for multilingual surface realisation

summary: Extendible framework for incorporation of arbitrary machine learning models in online network intrusion detection systems.
title: Online machine learning-based framework for network intrusion detection

summary: Implemented and compared the performances of several classification and regression models in predicting the results of horse races using data from Hong Kong Jockey Club.
title: Comparing machine learning models for horse race predictions

summary: Implemented a Deep Residual Neural Network in TensorFlow to detect Atrial Fibrillation using the dataset from PhysioNet Computing in Cardiology Challenge 2017.
title: Heart disease classification using deep residual learning
